info.content:
Katie has really got into Come Dine With Me, so we are all going to take a turn in hosting an evening. Tonight Mummy's menu was: Dough Balls, Egg and Bacon Pizza, Strawberry Ice Cream Sundaes.

The Guests

We had an early start as Charlotte came with us to Heathrow Airport to welcome back Ma Ma and Pop Pop from their New Zealand holiday. More importantly we were there to get our presents! However, we had to trade Jessica who went to stay at Ma Ma and Pop Pops for the night.

She luckily escaped not only the 5 mile run that Daddy and Charlotte later did, but also the long Regents Canal walk. There was a lot of traffic getting there and pretty cold outside. We even saw the odd flake of snow. Still not even the moaning from Katie and Ben deterred Mummy, Daddy and Charlotte from the walk which commenced at Kings Cross station.

Ben, within 5 minutes fell off the scooter, hurt his hands and began crying. Oh dear. Still we made it to the canal and had a lovely walk along, popping off at Camden to go up and down the high street. There were plenty of people shopping and there were loads of market stalls selling food.

We continued past London Zoo and Little Venice before we all were glad to see the car at Warwick Avenue. As Mummy says: That's another ticked off. We missed Jessica lots with her happy face.

Camden High Street

Happy Ben Over Regents Canal

title.value: Walk 42: Regents Canal Walk - Heathrow Pickup, Jessica sleepover

info.content:
Daddy went off to do his parkrun and smashed his best time by almost 2 minutes. PB is now set at 24:05. He was very happy. As soon as he came back home we went over to the Spectrum and met the Elders for a swim. It was really busy there, so the queues were quite long. Still we had fun on all the things. We didn't manage the 5m diving board this time though.

We all came back to our house where Daddy did a fry up, without anything actually being fried. We swapped Katie for Joey who stayed over for the night. We also accrued Charlotte at Hotel Gay.

title.value: Elders Spectrum Swim, PB in Parkrun, Joey and Katie swap sleepover

info.content:
We don't see Ron that often and now that he finds it difficult to travel long distances we arranged to meet with the rest of the Gay family over in the Royal Saracens pub in Beaconsfield. Ron wanted to treat us all to lunch which was very generous of him.

We did very well considering we were there for 4 hours and not a lot to entertain us. Still Daddy had a nice chat with Great Uncle Ron, comparing diabetes notes, recalling stories about his Dad and other stuff. He's quite a laid back, easy to talk to character.

It was nice to see everyone together.

The Gay Family

For valentines day mummy got another walk book, much to the delight of the children! It contains 45 walks all in the area, not much more than a 10 miles journey from home. Today was local, starting off at the Basingstoke canal at the bottom of Deepcut. Jessica had been upgraded to Katie's old bike. Unfortunately there was only one brake and Jessica found it hard to squeeze. So there were a few hairy moments along the route. Once she raced off the hill, went over a branch at pace, wobbled, kept her balance but then slowed to a halt by riding into a steep bank! Ben ended up crying a couple of times. Once for going over the handlebars right at the start and secondly by getting stuck in a deep puddle and getting soaked! Typical Benjamin.

It was a lovely ride as we explored parts of Deepcut and Frimley Green we never had before. We finally ended up at the Canal centre in Mytchett and then back home. A 4 hour epic ride which was only 7 miles long!

Hill Climb

Each year Katie has a sleepover with friends who all started Frimley Green playgroup on the same day, namely: Natasha, Grace and Nina. You couldn't see the carpet in the front room they made so much mess. No Barbie's were played with, instead there were boxing gloves and a tablet computer. They watched films and Pop Girl till about 11pm - midnightish which is relatively early for a Katie sleepover.

Daddy completed the ParkRun 15 seconds outside his best which was not very satisfying. However, he went out afterwards with the Balls for the ParkRun breakfast and was introduced the rest of the team.

Daddy bought mummy a booking at the hairdressers. Possibly the first haircut she has had for 3 or 4 years plus. Mummy was worried that if she had it cut short that'll Jessica would have nothing to cling onto. Still it didn't stop her. Ben said she looked beautiful when she came out. We all of course agreed.

Before and After Haircut

Whilst Mummy had her haircut the rest of us popped over to Auntie Susan's to have a drink and see the cats. Uncle Graham was at work. Later in the afternoon we were able to have another cuddle with Toby as the Elders came over for a cuppa.

title.value: Park Run, Mummy Haircut, Auntie Susan's and Elders

info.content:
Katie went with her youth group and daddy over to Guildford's Craggy Island for a spot of climbing. She loved it and was pretty good at it.

Climbing the walls

Mummy and Daddy were a little apprehensive about what was going to be said. Concentration levels and intelligence were the main issues. Jessica is as mad as a hatter. You never know what is going on upstairs in there. Well it seems a bit. She is working with some year ones for a couple of subjects. The teacher seemed very happy with her. The only thing was confidence in doing the work. She always checks what she does with the teacher before getting on with it. She always has the right idea. Mummy and Daddy were very pleased and proud of number 3!

We were at church for 3 hours today. Katie spoke at the front of church as part of her Brownies group.

In the afternoon Daddy took the three of us swimming at the Arena. Daddy was well impressed with Jessica's ability to swim only after two lessons. She must have done 5 metres. Hopefully with the rate of progression we'll have her out of armbands by the end of the year.

After we popped over to the Fars to see how they are doing and to wreck the joint as usual.

The weather was shocking today and after Daddy and Auntie Charlotte's morning Park Run we all went over to Alton to see our new cousin who was very sleepy during the day as he was awake all night! A very contented boy. Daddy cycled home through the rain.

Six Cousins

Sub 40 Family
We have a new cousin in Toby Elder who was induced out at 6pm, weighing in at 9lbs, 10 ounces. He was a healthy boy born at Basingstoke Hospital.
Daddy went off with his fellow London to Paris compatriots; Nick and Steven, on a training ride around the Chilterns.

Mummy helped organize the church party which went off very well. Ma Ma and Pop Pop came over as well as Uncle Peter and Great Grandma. In between times Katie went off to Leah Rushforth's 10th birthday party and it was nice to see Jessica and Aimee being best off buddies at Aimee's 5th birthday party held at Tomlinscote School.

Jessica and Aimee

Daddy and Ben also made a video for Ben's homework on the nine times table.

title.value: Church Party, Leah R 10th Birthday, Aimee H 5th Birthday

info.content: We had Great Grandma and Uncle Pete over for a nice Sunday Roast.

title.value: Great Grandma and Uncle Peter for Sunday lunch

info.content:
Last night Mummy and Daddy went out with the West's for a nice meal down the Swan in Ash Vale. Auntie Charlotte came around to stay the night even though she'd worked a double shift and was tired. Too tired to join Daddy in the Park Run, which was extremely muddy. It was a close run thing between James and Daddy. James took an early lead. With 400m to go Daddy ran past Mr Ball quite strongly, however, James had a bit left in the tank for a sprint finish. Time: 26:55 for 5km.

Auntie Charlotte departed. The Teale's came over in the afternoon. Daddy and Bradley planned their WWII fort kayak run in Kent. Summer and Katie played like a dream with each other. They have very imaginative minds when it comes to playing Barbies with one another! They didn't go to sleep until well gone midnight!

James beating Daddy in the Park Run.

Some more woes with the car. The battery has died again which means another bail out from the Fars. This time they stopped by for a spot of tea.

In the afternoon Daddy, Ben and Jessica ventured into the woods, wrapped up well, armed with two sledges and a few square miles of hilly woods. They managed to get to four hills, steadily getting better each time. By the end, Daddy's heart was in his mouth as Jessica slid down a fast icy track so fast she lay down flat on the sledge not seeing where she was going! Luckily she did not hit anything, and she absolutely loved the thrill!

We stayed out till gone dark which was a bit of a worry in the dark. Mummy and Katie came out as a search party worried Daddy had a diabetic coma! I ask ya. Anyway all was well and snuggled in and watched Harry Potter in the evening.

Sledging siblings

In the morning we went out to play in the snow. We took the sledges to the local fields and played on the smallest slopes in the world. Still we had it all to ourselves and we loved it. Daddy ended up pulling the three of us as quick as he could and made us all fall off!

In the afternoon we went to the Spectrum for a swim with the Elders and Ma Ma and Pop Pop. After singing happy birthday and a coffee we went into the relatively quiet pool. We had a great time on the slides and wave machine. We eventually made our way over to the diving boards to test our courage. We'd not done the 3.5m board before and although we just jumped off it, still we made it. Ben then went to the highest, 5m board. He chickened out at first, but after Daddy showed him the way, Ben did jump. With all our hearts in our mouths he surfaced unscathed. He was trembling with excitement at what he had just achieved. It made Daddy proud. It made Mummy not be there. She did not want to see it. Joey and Uncle Michael followed off the 5m platform as well. Ben had a total of 5 jumps off the top board. Katie had a look, but sense prevailed.

In the evening we went over to the Elders for Auntie Ellie's baby-shower. We gave her a nappy cake and played games. Katie joined in whilst the rest of us went to bed.

Jessica racing down the hill, helped on by Katie

title.value: Snow, Spectrum Swim, Ellie Baby Shower

info.content:
After church, Steven, Joyce and the cute Eva came over for Sunday lunch.

Jessica and Eva - Crafting away

title.value: Steven, Joyce and Eva for Sunday Lunch

info.content: Jessica has been on the Rainbows waiting list since the age of 2 and now she has started to go. She enjoyed her first outing and made a cool name badge.

Daddy joined Michael, Nick and Steve for a nice ride in the Spencers Wood, Aldermarston direction.

In the afternoon Mummy was helping Auntie Charlotte to find a job.

Martin just before riding out

Auntie Charlotte came to stay this weekend and this morning her and Daddy went to try the British Military Fitness session down at Frimley Lodge Park. Both were being a bit farty about it. Nervous they were going to something out of their league. There were 60 or so people there ranging from 20's to 60's year olds. It was an hour of almost non-stop jogging, squat trusts, burpees, mountain climbs, etc. Both survived with aching muscles.

In the afternoon we drew lots on where we were to go. The winning ticket was a trip with the bikes around California Country Park. After circuling the lake we went on the playground assault course where Katie won and Ben got in a bad mood for losing!

In the evening we snuggled up to watch the film, Nativity.

Daddy and Charlotte Post Fitness Session

California Country Park Walk

Grump Guts

title.value: British Military Fitness, California Country Park

info.content:
The West's arranged for us to go to Alice Holt with them for a nice walk in the mud. It was packed there, everyone had the same idea I think. The children were almost trying to get as muddy as possible!

When it came to leaving Daddy attempted the reverse the new car out of the mud so the rest of us could get in more easily. However, it was so muddy the wheels were spinning. In an attempt to get some traction, Daddy went forward and back at an angle. Mud was spraying everywhere. All Daddy could see was Mummy going absolutely beserk and almost having a nervous breakdown. Daddy had manoeuvred the car into a hollow, some would say shallow ditch and the front bumper was embedded into the grass verge / bank. Daddy didn't know this and wondered why the car would no longer go forward. By this stage Mummy I think let the whole car park at Daddy's shortcomings. Daddy was stuck and had even taken off his boots which now sat 5 meters away from the car in an effort to keep everything clean inside.

Stunned, Daddy just sat in the car for about a minute not knowing what to do. A man came across an offered to help get it out. First Daddy had to step out into the mud to get his boots back on, and then address the helpful man. Eventually 6 or 7 blokes came to help, I think in sympathy for Daddy's ear-bashing that he received. After a bit of pushing the car came out easily. However there was a little bit of damage on the under-carriage which cost Â£10 to fix. Mummy was still not happy for a good long while! funny story though.

Glorious Mud

title.value: Alice Holt Walk With West's - Car Ditched
